p: Methodological papers, not applied to a specified close-contact infection, mostly describe the conceptual usage of an IBM to simulate heterogeneous disease dynamics and targeted intervention strategies. Other studies were published on validation procedures [ 52, 53], performance issues [ 54, 55] and emulation to improve rapid policy making in various settings [ 55â€“ 58]. Models and model output have been calibrated and validated with observed incidence and (sero)prevalence data [ 49, 59, 60] but also with data generated by other models, such as deterministic ordinary differential equation models [ 61] or meta-populations models [ 62].
